intro: Biscutella ambigua var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved biscutella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in racemes and are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
